segment.source: Results for the Local Video Playback Assessment
segment.target: Results for the Local Video Playback Assessment

segment.source: Results for the Local Video Playback Assessment
segment.target: Results for the Local Video Playback Assessment

segment.source: Results for the Local Video Playback Assessment
segment.target: Results for the Local Video Playback Assessment

segment.source: Local Video Playback assessment results show metrics and issues that highlight energy efficiency problems.
segment.target: Local Video Playback assessment results show metrics and issues that highlight energy efficiency problems.

segment.source: When possible, the cause of the energy efficiency problem is identified.
segment.target: When possible, the cause of the energy efficiency problem is identified.

segment.source: For example, it could be drivers, processes, or services.
segment.target: For example, it could be drivers, processes, or services.

segment.source: Recommended solutions for these problems are provided.
segment.target: Recommended solutions for these problems are provided.

segment.source: This topic helps you interpret the results produced by a Battery Run Down job that uses the Local Video Playback assessment.
segment.target: This topic helps you interpret the results produced by a Battery Run Down job that uses the Local Video Playback assessment.

segment.source: It also provides guidance on how to use the results to identify and resolve common issues that negatively impact computer battery life.
segment.target: It also provides guidance on how to use the results to identify and resolve common issues that negatively impact computer battery life.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: Goals File
segment.target: Goals File

segment.source: Metrics
segment.target: Metrics

segment.source: Issues
segment.target: Issues

segment.source: For more information about Battery Run Down jobs, see Connected Standby Energy Efficiency.
segment.target: For more information about Battery Run Down jobs, see Connected Standby Energy Efficiency.

segment.source: Goals File
segment.target: Goals File

segment.source: You can create custom goals to measure your improvements in the Results View.
segment.target: You can create custom goals to measure your improvements in the Results View.

segment.source: Goals files are a triage tool that can help you understand how a PC is performing and to compare PCs in your business.
segment.target: Goals files are a triage tool that can help you understand how a PC is performing and to compare PCs in your business.

segment.source: For example, goals for a basic laptop might be different than the goals you set for a high end desktop computer, or market expectations might change in such a way that you want the flexibility to define different goals and key requirements as time passes and technology improves.
segment.target: For example, goals for a basic laptop might be different than the goals you set for a high end desktop computer, or market expectations might change in such a way that you want the flexibility to define different goals and key requirements as time passes and technology improves.

segment.source: When a metric value is compared to the goal for that metric, the status is color coded in the Result View as follows:
segment.target: When a metric value is compared to the goal for that metric, the status is color coded in the Result View as follows:

segment.source: Light purple means that the system has a great user experience and that there are no perceived problems.
segment.target: Light purple means that the system has a great user experience and that there are no perceived problems.

segment.source: Medium purple means that the user experience is tolerable and you can optimize the system.
segment.target: Medium purple means that the user experience is tolerable and you can optimize the system.

segment.source: Review the recommendations and analysis to see what improvements can be made to the system.
segment.target: Review the recommendations and analysis to see what improvements can be made to the system.

segment.source: These can be software changes, configuration changes or hardware changes.
segment.target: These can be software changes, configuration changes or hardware changes.

segment.source: Dark purple means that the system has a poor user experience and that there is significant room for improvements.
segment.target: Dark purple means that the system has a poor user experience and that there is significant room for improvements.

segment.source: Review the recommendations and analysis to see the improvements that can be made to the system.
segment.target: Review the recommendations and analysis to see the improvements that can be made to the system.

segment.source: These can be software changes, configuration changes or hardware changes.
segment.target: These can be software changes, configuration changes or hardware changes.

segment.source: You might have to consider making tradeoffs to deliver a high quality Windows experience.
segment.target: You might have to consider making tradeoffs to deliver a high quality Windows experience.

segment.source: No color means that there are no goals defined for the metric.
segment.target: No color means that there are no goals defined for the metric.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: In the Windows Assessment Toolkit for Windows 8, some assessments include default goals files.
segment.target: In the Windows Assessment Toolkit for Windows 8, some assessments include default goals files.

segment.source: The first time you view results using this version of the tools, the default goals file is used.
segment.target: The first time you view results using this version of the tools, the default goals file is used.

segment.source: However, you can also define custom goals for Windows 8 the same way that you can for Windows 8.1 and Windows 10.
segment.target: However, you can also define custom goals for Windows 8 the same way that you can for Windows 8.1 and Windows 10.

segment.source: You can set the goals file location and add a goals file to that location before you can use the UI to apply the custom goals.
segment.target: You can set the goals file location and add a goals file to that location before you can use the UI to apply the custom goals.

segment.source: Once a goals file is selected it will continue to be the goals file that is used for any results that are opened.
segment.target: Once a goals file is selected it will continue to be the goals file that is used for any results that are opened.

segment.source: Only one goals file can be used at a time.
segment.target: Only one goals file can be used at a time.

segment.source: Goals for all assessments are set in a single goals file.
segment.target: Goals for all assessments are set in a single goals file.

segment.source: The assessment tools will search for goals in the following order:
segment.target: The assessment tools will search for goals in the following order:

segment.source: A custom goals file
segment.target: A custom goals file

segment.source: Goals that are defined in the results file
segment.target: Goals that are defined in the results file

segment.source: Goals that are defined in the assessment manifest
segment.target: Goals that are defined in the assessment manifest

segment.source: You can use the sample goals file that is provided at %PROGRAMFILES%Windows Kits10Assessment and Deployment KitWindows Assessment ToolkitSDKSamplesGoals to create your own goals file.
segment.target: You can use the sample goals file that is provided at %PROGRAMFILES%Windows Kits10Assessment and Deployment KitWindows Assessment ToolkitSDKSamplesGoals to create your own goals file.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You cannot package a goals file with a job, but you can store it on a share for others to use.
segment.target: You cannot package a goals file with a job, but you can store it on a share for others to use.

segment.source: Metrics
segment.target: Metrics

segment.source: The following metrics are specific to the Local Video Playback assessment:
segment.target: The following metrics are specific to the Local Video Playback assessment:

segment.source: Diagnostic Mode Metrics
segment.target: Diagnostic Mode Metrics

segment.source: System Timer Resolution
segment.target: System Timer Resolution

segment.source: This metric represents the resolution, in milliseconds, of the system timer.
segment.target: This metric represents the resolution, in milliseconds, of the system timer.

segment.source: Processes Changing System Timer Resolution
segment.target: Processes Changing System Timer Resolution

segment.source: This metric represents the number of processes that request a system resolution change.
segment.target: This metric represents the number of processes that request a system resolution change.

segment.source: Processes using 1% CPU during idle period
segment.target: Processes using 1% CPU during idle period

segment.source: This metric represents the number of processes, excluding the video playback app, with at least 1% CPU utilization.
segment.target: This metric represents the number of processes, excluding the video playback app, with at least 1% CPU utilization.

segment.source: Storage read count
segment.target: Storage read count

segment.source: This metric represents the total number of storage reads during the assessment run.
segment.target: This metric represents the total number of storage reads during the assessment run.

segment.source: This excludes storage reads by the video playback app.
segment.target: This excludes storage reads by the video playback app.

segment.source: Data read from storage
segment.target: Data read from storage

segment.source: This metric represents the total size, in kilobytes, of data that was read from storage during the assessment run.
segment.target: This metric represents the total size, in kilobytes, of data that was read from storage during the assessment run.

segment.source: This excludes data that was read by the video playback app.
segment.target: This excludes data that was read by the video playback app.

segment.source: Storage write count
segment.target: Storage write count

segment.source: This metric represents the total number of writes to storage during the assessment run.
segment.target: This metric represents the total number of writes to storage during the assessment run.

segment.source: Data written to storage
segment.target: Data written to storage

segment.source: This metric represents the total size, in kilobytes, of data that was written to storage during the assessment run.
segment.target: This metric represents the total size, in kilobytes, of data that was written to storage during the assessment run.

segment.source: Storage flush count
segment.target: Storage flush count

segment.source: This metric represents the total number of storage flushes during the assessment run.
segment.target: This metric represents the total number of storage flushes during the assessment run.

segment.source: Processes reading 50 times
segment.target: Processes reading 50 times

segment.source: This metric represents the number of processes that read from storage more than 50 times during the assessment run.
segment.target: This metric represents the number of processes that read from storage more than 50 times during the assessment run.

segment.source: This excludes the video playback app.
segment.target: This excludes the video playback app.

segment.source: Processes reading 1 MB
segment.target: Processes reading 1 MB

segment.source: This metric represents the number of processes that read more than one megabyte from storage during the assessment run.
segment.target: This metric represents the number of processes that read more than one megabyte from storage during the assessment run.

segment.source: This excludes the video playback app.
segment.target: This excludes the video playback app.

segment.source: Processes writing to storage
segment.target: Processes writing to storage

segment.source: This metric represents the number of process that write to storage during the assessment run.
segment.target: This metric represents the number of process that write to storage during the assessment run.

segment.source: This excludes the video playback app.
segment.target: This excludes the video playback app.

segment.source: Other Metrics
segment.target: Other Metrics

segment.source: DFlip used by playback
segment.target: DFlip used by playback

segment.source: This metric represents whether DirectFlip was enabled while playing the media file in full-screen mode.
segment.target: This metric represents whether DirectFlip was enabled while playing the media file in full-screen mode.

segment.source: Issues
segment.target: Issues

segment.source: The Local Video Playback assessment performs advanced issue analysis and provides links to Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA) to troubleshoot the issues that are identified.
segment.target: The Local Video Playback assessment performs advanced issue analysis and provides links to Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA) to troubleshoot the issues that are identified.

segment.source: WPA might present additional details about disk activity or CPU activity depending on the types of issues that were identified.
segment.target: WPA might present additional details about disk activity or CPU activity depending on the types of issues that were identified.

segment.source: For more information about in-depth analysis issues and recommendations see, Common In-Depth Analysis Issues.
segment.target: For more information about in-depth analysis issues and recommendations see, Common In-Depth Analysis Issues.

segment.source: Below is a list of issues that you might encounter when running the Local Video Playback assessment.
segment.target: Below is a list of issues that you might encounter when running the Local Video Playback assessment.

segment.source: DirectFlip is not enabled
segment.target: DirectFlip is not enabled

segment.source: When DirectFlip is not enabled, an issue is generated that highlights the energy efficiency improvements that can be obtained when using DirectFlip.
segment.target: When DirectFlip is not enabled, an issue is generated that highlights the energy efficiency improvements that can be obtained when using DirectFlip.

segment.source: DirectFlip is not supported
segment.target: DirectFlip is not supported

segment.source: When DirectFlip is not supported on the display driver, an issue is generated that highlights the energy efficiency improvements that can be obtained when using DirectFlip.
segment.target: When DirectFlip is not supported on the display driver, an issue is generated that highlights the energy efficiency improvements that can be obtained when using DirectFlip.

segment.source: Total Storage Write Count
segment.target: Total Storage Write Count

segment.source: An issue is always generated that highlights the total number of writes to storage, along with the threshold.
segment.target: An issue is always generated that highlights the total number of writes to storage, along with the threshold.

segment.source: Writing data to storage increases power consumption.
segment.target: Writing data to storage increases power consumption.

segment.source: Total Writes to Storage
segment.target: Total Writes to Storage

segment.source: An issue is always generated that highlights the total size of the data written to storage during the assessment run.
segment.target: An issue is always generated that highlights the total size of the data written to storage during the assessment run.

segment.source: Writing data to storage increases power consumption.
segment.target: Writing data to storage increases power consumption.

segment.source: The assessment reports an exit code of 0x80050006
segment.target: The assessment reports an exit code of 0x80050006

segment.source: This error occurs when maintenance tasks have been registered on the PC but have not completed before the assessment run.
segment.target: This error occurs when maintenance tasks have been registered on the PC but have not completed before the assessment run.

segment.source: This prevents the assessment from running, as maintenance tasks often impact assessment metrics.
segment.target: This prevents the assessment from running, as maintenance tasks often impact assessment metrics.

segment.source: To resolve this issue, do one of the following:
segment.target: To resolve this issue, do one of the following:

segment.source: Ensure that the computer is connected to a network and is running on AC power.
segment.target: Ensure that the computer is connected to a network and is running on AC power.

segment.source: Manually initiate pending maintenance tasks with the following command from an elevated prompt:
segment.target: Manually initiate pending maintenance tasks with the following command from an elevated prompt:

segment.source: Disable regular and idle maintenance tasks, and stop all maintenance tasks before running the assessment.
segment.target: Disable regular and idle maintenance tasks, and stop all maintenance tasks before running the assessment.
